case_name: Aravali Golf Club v. the plaintiffs/respondents

facts.text: Appeal arises out of S.L.P (C) No.3358 of 2007

anchor.surface_text: O R D E R Arising out of S.L.P C  No.3358 of 2007 Heard learned companynsel for the parties. Leave granted.

facts.text: Heard learned counsel for the parties. Leave granted.

anchor.surface_text: Heard learned companynsel for the parties. Leave granted. This appeal by special leave is directed against the judgment and order dated 17th February, 2006 passed by a learned Single Judge of the High Court of Punjab and Haryana in R.S.A. No.666/2006 whereby the learned Single Judge has affirmed the judgment and decree passed by the First Appellate Court.

facts.text: Appeal directed against judgment and order dated 17th February 2006 by Single Judge of High Court of Punjab and Haryana in R.S.A. No.666/2006

anchor.surface_text: This appeal by special leave is directed against the judgment and order dated 17th February, 2006 passed by a learned Single Judge of the High Court of Punjab and Haryana in R.S.A. No.666/2006 whereby the learned Single Judge has affirmed the judgment and decree passed by the First Appellate Court. The brief facts which are necessary for the disposal of the present appeal are that the plaintiffs  respondents in this appeal  were appointed as Mali  gardener  in the service of the defendant-appellant, which is a golf club run by the Haryana Tourism Corporation in the year 1989 and 1988 respectively on daily wages.

facts.text: Single Judge affirmed judgment and decree of First Appellate Court

anchor.surface_text: ...in R.S.A. No.666/2006 whereby the learned Single Judge has affirmed the judgment and decree passed by the First Appellate Court.

facts.text: Plaintiffs-respondents appointed as Mali (gardener) in service of defendant-appellant (golf club run by Haryana Tourism Corporation) in 1989 and 1988 respectively on daily wages

anchor.surface_text: The brief facts which are necessary for the disposal of the present appeal are that the plaintiffs  respondents in this appeal  were appointed as Mali  gardener  in the service of the defendant-appellant, which is a golf club run by the Haryana Tourism Corporation in the year 1989 and 1988 respectively on daily wages. Subsequently in the year 1989 they were told to perform the duties of Tractor Drivers, though there was numberpost of tractor driver in the employers establishment.

facts.text: Plaintiff No.1 appointed as Mali on daily wage basis on 9.10.1989

anchor.surface_text: The appellants in their written statement submitted that the plaintiffs were appointed as Mali on a daily wage basis on 9.10.1989.

facts.text: Plaintiff No.2 (respondent No.2) engaged as Mali on daily wage basis w.e.f. 1.9.1988

anchor.surface_text: Similar is the case of respondent No.2 herein. He was engaged as Mali on daily wage basis w.e.f. 1.9.1988 and his services were also regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999.

facts.text: In 1989 they were told to perform duties of Tractor Drivers though no post of tractor driver

anchor.surface_text: Subsequently in the year 1989 they were told to perform the duties of Tractor Drivers, though there was numberpost of tractor driver in the employers establishment. However for a number of years they companytinued to be paid wages for the post of Mali.

facts.text: Paid wages of tractor driver on daily wage basis as per rates recommended by Deputy Commissioner after recommendation by Head Office

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter on a recommendation made by the Head Office, the appellants started paying them wages of tractor driver on daily wage basis, as per rates recommended by the Deputy Commissioner.

facts.text: Worked as tractor drivers for about a decade

anchor.surface_text: Though they companytinued to work for about a decade as tractor drivers, their services were regularized against the post of Mali in the year 1999 and number as tractor driver.

facts.text: Services regularized against post of Mali in 1999

anchor.surface_text: Though they companytinued to work for about a decade as tractor drivers, their services were regularized against the post of Mali in the year 1999 and number as tractor driver.

facts.text: Plaintiff No.1 regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999 which was accepted without protest

anchor.surface_text: In the meanwhile services of plaintiff No.1 was regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999 which was duly accepted by him without any protest.

facts.text: Plaintiff No.2 services regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999

anchor.surface_text: ...and his services were also regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999.

facts.text: Filed civil suit in April 2001 claiming regularization as tractor drivers

anchor.surface_text: When despite representations their grievance was number redressed, the respondents herein filed civil suit in the month of April, 2001 claiming regularization against the posts of tractor driver.

facts.text: Trial Court rejected claim, observed no post of tractor driver, plying tractor part of Mali job, suit dismissed

anchor.surface_text: Their claim was rejected by the Trial Court which observed that there was numberpost of tractor driver in the establishment, and the suit was dismissed. The Trial Court held that plying a tractor is part and parcel of the job of Mali in a Golf Club, since the Golf Field of the Club is vast and needs to be maintained with mechanical gadgets.

facts.text: Appeal before Additional District Judge, Faridabad accepted, trial judgment set aside, directed sanction post of tractor driver and regularize plaintiffs

anchor.surface_text: Aggrieved against the said order of dismissal of the suit, the respondents herein preferred an appeal before the Additional District Judge, Faridabad. Their appeal was accepted and the judgment and decree of the Trial Court was set aside. The First Appellate Court observed that the defendants were taking the work of tractor driver from the plaintiffs since 13.8.1999, and hence it directed the defendants to get the post of tractor driver sanctioned, and to regularize the plaintiffs on that post.

facts.text: First Appellate Court observed defendants taking work of tractor driver since 13.8.1999

anchor.surface_text: The First Appellate Court observed that the defendants were taking the work of tractor driver from the plaintiffs since 13.8.1999, and hence it directed the defendants to get the post of tractor driver sanctioned, and to regularize the plaintiffs on that post.

facts.text: Divisional Manager Aravali Golf Club filed second appeal before High Court of Punjab and Haryana

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter the Divisional Manager, Aravali Golf Club filed a second appeal before the High Court of Punjab and Haryana.

facts.text: Single Judge held post of tractor driver should be created, dismissed second appeal, upheld First Appellate Court

anchor.surface_text: The learned Single Judge held that the post of tractor driver should be created as there is numberhitch in number creating the posts of drivers especially when tractors were available and there existed need to use those tractors. ... Hence, the second appeal was dismissed and the judgment of the First Appellate Court was upheld.

facts.text: No sanctioned post of tractor driver in establishment, undisputed

anchor.surface_text: It is number disputed that there is numbersanctioned post of tractor driver in the appellants establishment.

facts.text: Plaintiff-respondent No.1 filed Writ Petition No.6216/1991 for regularizing services

anchor.surface_text: The respondent No.1 had earlier filed Writ Petition No.6216/1991 for regularizing his services.

facts.text: High Court disposed writ petition directing representation against termination, restrained termination till decided

anchor.surface_text: The Honble High Court disposed of the said writ petition by passing the order directing the respondent No.1 to make a representation against the termination of his services and the appellants herein were restrained from terminating the services of the respondent No.1 till his representation was decided.

facts.text: Respondent No.1 made representation on 2.5.1991

anchor.surface_text: In pursuance of the said order the respondent No.1 made representation for regularization of his service on 2.5.1991.

facts.text: Informed vide order dated 14.5.1991 no post of tractor driver, case considered when sanctioned

anchor.surface_text: The plaintiff- respondent was informed vide order dated 14.5.1991 that there was numberpost of tractor driver and his case for regularization would be companysidered as and when sanctioned post of the tractor deriver will be available.

facts.text: Paid wages of tractor driver from August 1990 to 11.5.1999 on daily wage DC rate

anchor.surface_text: The plaintiff-respondent was paid wages of tractor deriver from August 1990 to 11.5.1999 on daily wage basis on D.C. rate as he was asked to work as a tractor driver.

facts.text: Trial Court recorded finding of fact no sanctioned post of tractor driver, plaintiffs cannot be regularized

anchor.surface_text: On the basis of these pleadings, several issues were framed and a finding was recorded by the Trial Court that as there is numbersanctioned post of tractor driver, the plaintiffs cannot be regularized in the said post.

facts.text: Supreme Court sets aside High Court and First Appellate Court orders, upholds Trial Court, dismisses suit

anchor.surface_text: Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed...
S.L.P C  No.3358 of 2007

issues.text: Whether the plaintiffs/respondents can be regularized in the post of tractor driver absent any sanctioned post?

anchor.surface_text: On the basis of these pleadings, several issues were framed and a finding was recorded by the Trial Court that as there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver, the plaintiffs cannot be regularized in the said post. This is a finding of fact recorded by the Trial Court and it was never disputed at any stage.

issues.text: Whether the First Appellate Court and Single Judge had jurisdiction to direct creation of tractor driver posts and regularization of respondents thereon?

anchor.surface_text: Since there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver against which the respondents could be regularized as tractor driver, the direction of the First Appellate Court and the learned Single Judge to create the post of tractor driver and regularizing the services of the respondents against the said newly created posts was in our opinion completely beyond their jurisdiction. The Court cannot direct the creation of posts.

issues.text: Whether any substantial question of law arose in the second appeal warranting interference?

anchor.surface_text: The learned Single Judge also held that nosubstantial question of law arose in the matter. Hence, the second appeal was dismissed and the judgment of the First Appellate Court was upheld.

issues.text: Whether courts can arrogate executive/legislative function of creating and sanctioning posts?

anchor.surface_text: Creation and sanction of posts is a prerogative of the executive or legislative authorities and the Court cannot arrogate to itself this purely executive or legislative function, and direct creation of posts in any organization.

issues.text: Whether judicial directions for post creation violate separation of powers and require judicial restraint?

holdings.text: Judges must exercise judicial restraint and must not encroach into the executive or legislative domain

holdings.reasoning_summary: Cited precedents emphasize restraint to avoid unconstitutional overreach

holdings.text: Under our Constitution, the Legislature, Executive and Judiciary all have their own broad spheres of operation. Ordinarily it is not proper for any of these three organs of the State to encroach upon the domain of another

anchor.surface_text: Under our Constitution, the Legislature, Executive and Judiciary all have their own broad spheres of operation. Ordinarily it is not proper for any of these three organs of the State to encroach upon the domain of another, otherwise the delicate balance in the Constitution will be upset,

holdings.reasoning_summary: Broad separation of powers to maintain constitutional balance

holdings.text: There is broad separation of powers under the Constitution and each organ of the State the legislature, the executive and the judiciary must have respect for the others and must not encroach into each others domains

anchor.surface_text: It is not disputed that there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver in the appellants establishment.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and ar

Since there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver against which the respondents could be regularized as tractor driver, the direction of the First Appellate Court and the learned Single Judge to create the post of tractor driver and regularizing the services of the respondents against the said

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and ar

Creation and sanction of posts is a prerogative of the executive or legislative authorities and the Court cannot arrogate to itself this purely executive or legislative function, and direct creation of posts in any organization.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and ar

This Court has time and again pointed out that the creation of a post is an executive or legislative function and it involves economic factors. Hence the Courts cannot take upon themselves the power of creation of a post.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and ar
